wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant General Sir William Pitcairn Campbell (or Pitcairn-Campbell),  (20 June 1856 – 22 September 1933) was a British Army General during World War I.

response: *1916–1918: Lt-Gen. Sir William Pitcairn Campbell, KCB
*Lieutenant General Sir William Pitcairn Campbell, KCB (1856–1933), British general during World War I and Aide-de-Camp to King Edward VII
* William Pitcairn Campbell (1856–1933), British Army general during World War I

In 1903, Hildyard had been appointed Colonel of the Highland Light Infantry and he continued to serve at the head of the regiment until his death in 1916, when he was succeeded by Sir William Pitcairn Campbell.The Highland Light Infantry: Succession of Colonels 1777–1957 at britisharmedforces.org
*Colonel (Brigadier-General) William Pitcairn Campbell, A.D.C. (late King's Royal Rifle Corps), Brigadier-General, 5th Brigade, 3rd Division, Aldershot Army Corps.
*Lieutenant-General William Pitcairn Campbell , General Officer Commanding-in-Chief, Southern Command.
*William Pitcairn Campbell (1856–1933), British Army lieutenant general
